name: PARTH SHAH
intro: Hi there! Nice to meet you :)
Scroll down to know me better!
about:
I am a software engineer specializing in integrating AI solutions with products. I have a short yet diverse experience working in various areas like web development, data science, devops, backend development as well as app developement.

I am currently a graduate research assistant at the University of Florida, pursuing a Master's degree. My current research interests are Variational Autoencoders and data compression.

When not fooling around with deep learning architectures, I like cooking and sketching.

vae.title: VAE - Scientific data compression
vae.subtitle: Modern Artificial Intelligence and Learning Technologies (MALT) lab
vae.desc:
(In Progress)
We propose a novel architecture for autoencoders and variational autoencoders for the associated problem statements in image compression and image generation. This method is also easily extensible to higher dimensional data like in scientific data domains, which is the primary focus of this project.
Advisors: Dr. Ranka and Dr. Rangarajan

atspm.title: Temporal data - Traffic estimation
atspm.subtitle: Modern Artificial Intelligence and Learning Technologies (MALT) lab
atspm.desc:
Estimation of travel times and queue lengths at signalized road intersections by analysing data from Automated Traffic Signal Performance Measures (ATSPM). In simple terms, induction loop sensors record vehicles passing over them. This data can be used to estimate traffic conditions.

Accepted for presentation at the 23rd Intelligent Transportation Systems Conference (IEEE ITSC 2020)

* This work is supported by NSF CNS 1922782, by the Florida Dept. of Transportation (FDOT) and FDOT District 5.

iheal.title: Intelligent ICU
iheal.subtitle: Intelligent Health Systems Lab (i-Heal)
iheal.desc: Transforming patient care in the Intensive Care Unit by developing autonomous monitoring tools using advanced machine learning techniques. Currently, many critical care indices are not captured automatically at a granular level, rather are repetitively assessed by overburdened nurses. In this pilot study, the lab examined the feasibility of using pervasive sensing technology and artiﬁcial intelligence for autonomous and granular monitoring in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

ruleStudio.title: Visual programming - Rule studio
ruleStudio.desc: Built a proprietary drag and drop tool to aid creation of domain specific rules. Led the end-to-end process from ideation and architecture design to production and CI/CD. My proposal of utilizing visual programming led to an improvement of 80% in the average turn around time of a rule. Visual programming library: Google blockly

liveSense.title: HERE Live Sense SDK
liveSense.desc:
Rapid prototyping and R&D for a technical feasibility study for a new product. Successful completion of the same lead to the eventual release of the HERE LiveSense SDK. To quote HERE, this is an AI-powered SDK that transforms camera-enabled devices into hazard awareness sensors for drivers.
Real-time object detection on edge devices with hardware constraints was very challenging as well as fun to solve. We worked on Android as well as iOS versions of the SDK.

duppoi.title: Duplicate Points of Interests
duppoi.desc: Crowdsourced or data aggregated from different sources causes a lot fo duplicate places in geospatial data. This project aimed to reduce/eliminate human work hours required to identify and remove such duplicates.

fml.title: Course project - alphabet recognition
fml.desc: Final project for the course (EEL5840) Fundamentals of Machine Learning. Achieved the highest test accuracy on the classification task amongst all submissions.

dss.title: Course project - decision support system
dss.desc: Final project for the course Human Computer Interfaces. The aim was to create decision support sytem for course administrators and course creators and also to facilitate student registrations.

garbage.title: Smart Monitoring System
garbage.desc: Handling the massive amounts of garbage produced in typical Indian cities has always been a tough job for the local administrators. The aim of this project was to make a smart monitoring system which will provide vital logistical support to the civic bodies in solid waste management.

noc.title: Network-on-chip
noc.subtitle: Fault tolerant application specific network-on-chip
noc.desc:
Network-on-chip is a big component of the state-of-the-art chip architectures today. In this publication we propose We propose a greedy algorithm to generate fault tolerant network topologies which performs better than the classic minimum spanning tree or the popular De-Bruijn’s algorithm on metrics like the communication cost and hardware requirements.

This work is partially supported by the research project No. ECR/2016/001389 dt. 06/03/2017, sponsored by the SERB, Govt. of India.

Publication: 10.1109/ISED.2017.8303920
P. Shah, A. Kanniganti and J. Soumya, "Fault-tolerant application specific Network-on-Chip design," 2017 7th International Symposium on Embedded Computing and System Design (ISED), Durgapur, 2017, pp. 1-5.

this.title: This website
this.desc:
An open and free interactive live resume template. Designed from scratch and implemented using the Vue.js framework.

A bit of recursion is always fun! Use this template for your own site.
